channel.title: Books on Mmoumni
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Mmoumni

item.title: Learn Concurrent Programming In Go
item.description:
Summary

Learn Concurrent Programming In Go provides a comprehensive guide to building concurrent applications using Go’s powerful concurrency primitives. The book covers goroutines, channels, and patterns for building responsive and high-performance software.

ðŸ“š Read my full notes on Notion

item.title: Same as Ever
item.description:
Summary

Same as Ever by Morgan Housel explores timeless principles of human behavior, risk, expectations, and storytelling that remain constant despite changing times. The book examines fundamental truths about how people think, make decisions, and navigate uncertainty.

ðŸ“š Read my full notes on Notion

item.title: Go In Action
item.description:
Summary

Go In Action is a practical guide to the Go programming language that covers core concepts and demonstrates how to build real-world applications. The book provides hands-on examples and covers essential Go features including concurrency, packages, and best practices.

item.title: The Design of Web APIs
item.description:
Summary

The Design of Web APIs provides comprehensive guidance on designing well-structured, consumer-friendly web APIs. The book covers fundamental principles of API design, focusing on creating intuitive, consistent, and easy-to-use interfaces that prioritize the consumer’s perspective.

item.title: Deep Work
item.description:
Summary

Deep Work by Cal Newport argues that the ability to perform deep, focused work is becoming increasingly rare and valuable in our economy. The book provides strategies for cultivating the ability to work without distraction on cognitively demanding tasks.

item.title: A Mind For Numbers
item.description:
Summary

A Mind For Numbers by Barbara Oakley provides practical techniques for learning effectively and mastering challenging subjects. The book covers essential learning strategies including chunking, memory enhancement, procrastination prevention, and evidence-based study methods.

ðŸ“š Read my full notes on Notion

item.title: The Psychology Of Money
item.description:
Summary

The Psychology of Money by Morgan Housel explores the behavioral and psychological aspects of financial decision-making. The book reveals that making smart financial decisions isn’t strongly related to intelligence or education, but rather to understanding the behavioral side of money management.
